intro: Actinomeris tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
